SEARCH
Module org.klojang.util
Package org.klojang.util

Record Class ArrayType

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
org.klojang.util.ArrayType
Record Components:
baseType - The lowest-level component type
dimensions - The number of dimensions
public record ArrayType(Class<?> baseType, int dimensions) extends Record
Provides metadata about an array type. An ArrayType consists of a base type and a dimension count. The base type is the lowest-level component type of an array class. So for int[][][] that would be int and not int[][]. In other words, the base type of an array always is a non-array type.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArrayType

      public ArrayType(Class<?> baseType, int dimensions)
      Creates a new ArrayType instance. The baseType argument is itself allowed to be an array type, but the base type recorded by the instance will then be the base type of that array type, and the number of dimensions of the array type will then be added to the specified number of dimensions. The specified number of dimensions may then even be zero or negative, as long as the sum of the dimensions remains positive: 
      
 ArrayType threeD = new ArrayType(float[][].class, 1); // float[][][].class
 ArrayType oneD = new ArrayType(float[][].class, -1); // float[].class
      Parameters:
      baseType - The base type of the array
      dimensions - The number of dimensions

  • Method Details

    • describe

      public static String describe(Object array)
      Returns a description of the provided array. It contains the base type's simple class name and the length of the outermost array. For example, for an array defined as new Double[4][12], it would return "Double[4][]".
      Parameters:
      array - The array to describe
      Returns:
      A description of the array

    • forClass

      public static ArrayType forClass(Class<?> arrayClass)
      Returns the ArrayType corresponding to the specified array class. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided object is not an array type.
      Parameters:
      arrayClass - The array class
      Returns:
      The ArrayType instance

    • forArray

      public static ArrayType forArray(Object array)
      Returns the ArrayType corresponding to the specified array object. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided object is not an array.
      Parameters:
      array - The array
      Returns:
      The ArrayType instance

    • dimensions

      public static int dimensions(Class<?> c)
      Returns zero for non-array types, and the number of dimensions for array types.
      Parameters:
      c - The type for which to get the number of dimensions
      Returns:
      The dimensionality of the type.

    • toClass

      Returns the Class object corresponding to this ArrayType.
      Returns:
      A Class object

    • toClass

      public Class<?> toClass(Class<?> baseType)
      Returns the Class object corresponding to an ArrayType with the specified base type and with the same number of dimensions as this instance.
      Returns:
      A Class object

    • box

      public Class<?> box()
      Returns the Class object corresponding to an ArrayType equal to this one, but with the boxed version of the base type. So for int[][].class it would return Integer[][].class. If the base type is not a primitive type, this method is equivalent to toClass().
      Returns:
      A Class object
      See Also:
      • ClassMethods.box(Class)

    • unbox

      public Class<?> unbox()
      Returns the Class object corresponding to an ArrayType equal to this one, but with the unboxed version of the base type. So for Float[][].class it would return float[][].class. If the base type is not a primitive type, this method is equivalent to toClass().
      Returns:
      A Class object
      See Also:
      • ClassMethods.unbox(Class)

    • toClass

      public Class<?> toClass(int dimensions)
      Returns the Class object corresponding to an ArrayType with the specified number of dimensions and with the same base type as this instance.
      Returns:
      A Class object

    • boxed

      public ArrayType boxed()
      Returns the ArrayType for the boxed version of the base type.
      Returns:
      The ArrayType for the boxed version of the base type

    • unboxed

      public ArrayType unboxed()
      Returns the ArrayType for the unboxed version of the base type.
      Returns:
      The ArrayType for the unboxed version of the base type

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the simple class name of the array type encoded by this instance. The returned string is somewhat easier to read than what you get from Class.getSimpleName(). For example the returned value for int[][].class would be "int[][]".
      Specified by:
      toString in class Record
      Returns:
      The simple class name of the array type encoded by this ArrayType

    • arrayClassName

      public String arrayClassName()
      Returns the fully-qualified class name of the array type encoded by this instance. The returned string is somewhat easier to read than what you get from Class.getName(). For example, the returned value for String[][].class would be "java.lang.String[][]".
      Returns:
      The fully-qualified class name of the array type encoded by this ArrayType

    • hashCode

      public final int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this object. The value is derived from the hash code of each of the record components.
      Specified by:
      hashCode in class Record
      Returns:
      a hash code value for this object

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. Reference components are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object); primitive components are compared with '=='.
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
